title: Meaning of Slope in Speed and Mileage Relationship
question_text:
The speed (in kilometers per hour) and mileage (in kilometers per liter) of $13\text{ cars}$ was measured. The regression equation is as follows:
$$\text{Mileage (km per liter)}= -1.8 + 0.536 \times \text{Speed (km per hour)}$$

Predictor Coef SE Coef T P
Constant -1.8 8.357 -0.22 0.8333
Kilometers per hour 0.536 0.1192 4.5 0.001


According to this model, an increase in speed of $10$ kilometers per hour would change the fuel economy by
tables:
PredictorCoefSE CoefTP
Constant-1.88.357-0.220.8333
Kilometers per hour0.5360.11924.50.001

An increase of 5.36 kilometers per liter
.
